item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, September 12, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Data sleuths who spotted research misconduct cleared of defamation (18 points | 1 comment)
2. Learning to Reason with LLMs (1315 points | 1018 comments)
3. Show HN: iFixit created a new USB-C, repairable soldering system (621 points | 305 comments)
4. F3 – Fight Flash Fraud (18 points | 5 comments)
5. Defusedxml – defusing XML bombs and other exploits (53 points | 12 comments)
6. GAZEploit: Remote keystroke inference attack by gaze estimation in VR/MR devices (140 points | 77 comments)
7. Exploding Head Syndrome: What We Know About This Mysterious Disorder (44 points | 35 comments)
8. Random access string compression with FSST and Rust (24 points | discuss)
9. Kolmogorov-Arnold networks may make neural networks more understandable (208 points | 62 comments)
10. EasyPost (YC S13) Is Hiring ( | hide)
11. If I could dissect a sauropod (94 points | 12 comments)
12. Why Haskell? (282 points | 387 comments)
13. Show HN: Galaxy Visualization (43 points | 11 comments)
14. Jax and Equinox: What are they and why should I bother? (33 points | 4 comments)
15. Ask HN: Should I open source my licensing server? (4 points | 7 comments)
16. Show HN: Goroutine Monitor Powered by eBPF (58 points | 2 comments)
17. DEF Con 32 – AMD Sinkclose Universal Ring-2 Privilege Escalation (Not Redacted) [pdf] (176 points | 24 comments)
18. Linear, symmetric, self-selecting 14-bit molecular memristors (2023) (92 points | 53 comments)
19. Peer Gynt quilt, Part 1 (2021) (59 points | 5 comments)
20. Qubit Transistors Reach Error Correction Benchmark (56 points | 16 comments)
21. Ergo: Erlang-inspired event driven actor framework in Go (136 points | 83 comments)
22. 1913: When Hitler, Trotsky, Tito, Freud and Stalin all lived in the same place (160 points | 94 comments)
23. Ask HN: Is a Masters in CS/Engineering worth it for a mid-career PM? (14 points | 5 comments)
24. Show HN: Repogather – copy relevant files to clipboard for LLM coding workflows (45 points | 23 comments)
25. We spent $20 to achieve RCE and accidentally became the admins of .mobi (1525 points | 341 comments)
26. Exponential Rate Limiting (87 points | 19 comments)
27. Critical Resources and the First 14 KB (2022) (63 points | 7 comments)
28. Show HN: I built TikTok but for studying with quizzes from your own notes (20 points | 5 comments)
29. Show HN: SnazzyPDF – Convert Any JSON Data to Beautifully Formatted PDFs (6 points | 1 comment)
30. The Minneapolis Street Grid: Explained (124 points | 56 comments)
